newsitem.title: USA: Staples to take $520 million in charges.
newsitem.headline: Staples to take $520 million in charges.

text.p: Staples Inc Chief Operating Officer Martin Hanaka said the planned acquisition of Office Depot Inc would result in one-time charges of $520 million.
"One time charges are estimated to be about $520 million in total," he told reporters and analysts on a conference call.

He said $125 million in charges will be taken for store and distribution center closings, $150 milllion for store remodeling, $100 million for inventory integration and $145 milllion for transaction and other costs.
Staples Chief Executive Thomas Stemberg said the $3.6 billion merger will be accretive to earnings, resulting in earnings per share growth of "north of 40 pct for 1997, after charges."
"We are very comfortable endorsing a growth rate (in earnings per share) north of 30 percent for the years 1998 and 1999 for the combined companies," he added.

Stemberg said revenues would top $10 billion in 1996 and he expects sales growth of more than 20 percent in 1997. He said the sales growth rate should be "healthy" but down a few percentage points for 1998 and beyond.
